chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
f: A -> nat

Goal:
forall l1 l2 l3 l4 : list (btree A), weight_tree_list f l1 = weight_tree_list f l2 -> same_sum_leaves f l1 l2 -> one_step l1 l3 -> one_step l2 l4 -> weight_tree_list f l3 = weight_tree_list f l4 /\ same_sum_leaves f l3 l4

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
same_sum_leaves : forall A : Type, (A -> nat) -> list (btree A) -> list (btree A) -> Prop
one_step = fun l1 l2 : list (btree A) => exists (l3 : list (btree A)) (t1 t2 : btree A), ordered (sum_order f) (t1 :: t2 :: l3) /\ permutation l1 (t1 :: t2 :: l3) /\ permutation l2 (node t1 t2 :: l3) : list (btree A) -> list (btree A) -> Prop Arguments one_step (_ _)%list_scope
Inductive btree (A : Type) : Type := leaf : A -> btree A | node : btree A -> btree A -> btree A Arguments btree _%type_scope Arguments leaf [A]%type_scope Arguments node [A]%type_scope
weight_tree_list : forall A : Type, (A -> nat) -> list (btree A) -> nat
one_step_weight_tree_list : forall l1 l2 l3 : list (btree A), one_step l1 l2 -> one_step l1 l3 -> weight_tree_list f l2 = weight_tree_list f l3
one_step_same_sum_leaves : forall l1 l2 l3 : list (btree A), one_step l1 l2 -> one_step l1 l3 -> same_sum_leaves f l2 l3
weight_tree_list_permutation : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> nat) (l1 l2 : list (btree A)), permutation l1 l2 -> weight_tree_list f l1 = weight_tree_list f l2
permutation_app_comp : forall (A : Type) (l1 l2 l3 l4 : list A), permutation l1 l2 -> permutation l3 l4 -> permutation (l1 ++ l3) (l2 ++ l4)
map2_app : forall (A B C : Type) (f : A -> B -> C) (l1 : list A) (l2 : list B) (l3 : list A) (l4 : list B), length l1 = length l2 -> map2 f (l1 ++ l3) (l2 ++ l4) = map2 f l1 l2 ++ map2 f l3 l4
same_sum_leaves_length : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> nat) (l1 l2 : list (btree A)), same_sum_leaves f l1 l2 -> length l1 = length l2
permutation_trans : forall (A : Type) (l1 l2 l3 : list A), permutation l1 l2 -> permutation l2 l3 -> permutation l1 l3
same_length_ex : forall (A B : Type) (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A) (l3 : list B), length (l1 ++ a :: l2) = length l3 -> exists (l4 l5 : list B) (b : B), length l1 = length l4 /\ length l2 = length l5 /\ l3 = l4 ++ b :: l5
weight_tree_list_node : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> nat) (t1 t2 : btree A) (l : list (btree A)), weight_tree_list f (node t1 t2 :: l) = sum_leaves f t1 + sum_leaves f t2 + weight_tree_list f (t1 :: t2 :: l)
fold_left_permutation : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B -> A), (forall (a : A) (b1 b2 : B), f (f a b1) b2 = f (f a b2) b1) -> forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list B), permutation l1 l2 -> fold_left f l1 a = fold_left f l2 a
permutation_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l1 l2 -> permutation (map f l1) (map f l2)
permutation_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), P [] [] -> (forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l2 l1 -> P l2 l1 -> P (a :: l2) (a :: l1)) -> (forall (a b : A) (l : list A), P (a :: b :: l) (b :: a :: l)) -> (forall l1 l2 l3 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> P l1 l2 -> permutation l2 l3 -> P l2 l3 -> P l1 l3) -> forall l l0 : list A, permutation l l0 -> P l l0
Inductive permutation (A : Type) : list A -> list A -> Prop := permutation_nil : permutation [] [] | permutation_skip : forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l2 l1 -> permutation (a :: l2) (a :: l1) | permutation_swap : forall (a b : A) (l : list A), permutation (a :: b :: l) (b :: a :: l) | permutation_trans : forall l1 l2 l3 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> permutation l2 l3 -> permutation l1 l3 Arguments permutation [A]%type_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments permutation_nil _%type_scope Arguments permutation_skip _%type_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments permutation_swap _%type_scope _ _ _%list_scope Arguments permutation_trans _%type_scope (_ _ _)%list_scope
ordered_sum_leaves_eq : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> nat) (l1 l2 : list (btree A)), permutation l1 l2 -> ordered (sum_order f) l1 -> ordered (sum_order f) l2 -> map (sum_leaves f) l1 = map (sum_leaves f) l2
permutation_all_permutations_aux : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (l1 l2 : list A), n = length l2 -> permutation l1 l2 -> In l1 (all_permutations_aux A l2 n)
all_permutations_aux_permutation : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (l1 l2 : list A), n = length l2 -> In l1 (all_permutations_aux A l2 n) -> permutation l1 l2
Nat.max_min_antimono : forall f : nat -> nat, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq eq) f -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful le (Basics.flip le)) f -> forall x y : nat, Nat.max (f x) (f y) = f (Nat.min x y)
cover_permutation : forall (A : Type) (t : btree A) (l1 l2 : list (btree A)), cover l1 t -> permutation l1 l2 -> cover l2 t
ordered_perm_antisym_eq : forall (A : Type) (order : A -> A -> Prop), (forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c) -> (forall a b : A, order a b -> order b a -> a = b) -> forall l1 l2 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> ordered order l1 -> ordered order l2 -> l1 = l2
ulist_app : forall (A : Type) (l1 l2 : list A), ulist l1 -> ulist l2 -> (forall a : A, In a l1 -> In a l2 -> False) -> ulist (l1 ++ l2)
map_app : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l l' : list A), map f (l ++ l') = map f l ++ map f l'
in_map_inv : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (b : B) (l : list A), In b (map f l) -> exists a : A, In a l /\ b = f a
le_sum_correct1 : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> nat) (a b1 : btree A), le_sum f a b1 = true -> sum_order f a b1
le_sum_correct2 : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> nat) (a b1 : btree A), le_sum f a b1 = false -> sum_order f b1 a
all_permutations_permutation : forall (A : Type) (l1 l2 : list A), In l1 (all_permutations l2) -> permutation l1 l2
permutation_all_permutations : forall (A : Type) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l1 l2 -> In l1 (all_permutations l2)
f_equal_nat : forall (B : Type) (f : nat -> B) (x y : nat), x = y -> f x = f y
fold_left_init : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B -> A) (h : A -> A), (forall (a : A) (b : B), h (f a b) = f (h a) b) -> forall (a : A) (l : list B), fold_left f l (h a) = h (fold_left f l a)
cover_inv_app_aux : forall (A : Type) (t t1 t2 : btree A) (l : list (btree A)), cover l t -> t = node t1 t2 -> l = [node t1 t2] \/ (exists l1 l2 : list (btree A), (cover l1 t1 /\ cover l2 t2) /\ permutation l (l1 ++ l2))
Nat.eqf = fun f g : nat -> bool => forall n : nat, f n = g n : (nat -> bool) -> (nat -> bool) -> Prop Arguments Nat.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
